definition: to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining

sentences.english: Maybe she dresses well, is efficient or extremely punctual.
sentences.chinese: 比如，夸女孩衣着得体，办事有效率或者是极其守时。

sentences.english: A: First they’d say I am very punctual.
sentences.chinese: 首先他们会说我是一个非常守时的人。

sentences.english: He is punctual. He never breaks his words.
We should try to be punctual forever.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该尽量做到永远守时。

sentences.english: Another example. You have a feeling that even though you're usually on time,
sentences.chinese: 再说一个例子。尽管你一直是个守时的人，

sentences.english: If you want to become more punctual, clarify the concept behind the definition of what you are.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想变得更加守时，弄清楚这对你的意义。

sentences.english: The principle, design and manufacture of this type of Hydrogen maser are described in this…
sentences.chinese: 本文将描述这种守时型氢脉泽标准的设计与研制情况。

sentences.english: His habit of punctuality has not changed since he was eight years old.
sentences.chinese: 他守时的习惯自八岁以来一直没改。

sentences.english: The unpunctual man , on the other hand, never does what he has to do at the proper time .
sentences.chinese: 反之，不守时的人从不按时完成他应该做的事。

sentences.english: His unpunctuality served as an excuse to get rid of him.
sentences.chinese: 他的不守时成为开除他的借口。

sentences.english: As exactness is kindness, he was exact.
sentences.chinese: 因为守时是一种仁爱，他总是守时的。

sentences.english: As exactness is kindness, he was exact.
sentences.chinese: 因为守时是一种仁爱，他总是守时的。

sentences.english: No punctuality is a bad habit. We should get rid of it.
sentences.chinese: 不守时是坏习惯，我们应改掉它。

sentences.english: She said bitterly to me that this was as bad as being praised for punctuality.
sentences.chinese: 她忿忿地对我说，这就跟被称赞守时一样糟糕。

sentences.english: Promptness is valued highly in American life, for example.
sentences.chinese: 比如，在美国人的生活中，是否守时被看得很重要。

definition: to behave oneself/to abide by the rules
to speak and keep one's promise (idiom); as good as one's word
to be strict with oneself (idiom)/to demand a lot of oneself
to work/to handle matters/to have a job
never put off until tomorrow what you can do today (idiom)
pinyin: jin1 ri4 shi4 jin1 ri4 bi4

definition: (idiom) one's actions are in keeping with what one says
one must be a man of his word and resolute in his work (proverb)
pinyin: yan2 bi4 xin4 , xing2 bi4 guo3
